etri.sdn.controller

Class TorpedoProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • etri.sdn.controller.TorpedoProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>

    public final class TorpedoProperties
extends java.util.Properties
    This class implements a functionality that reads Torpedo configuration file (torpedo.properties in the project root directory).
    Author:
    bjlee
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • propertyExists

        public boolean propertyExists(java.lang.String name)
        Check if there is a property value associated with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - name of the property value
        Returns:
        true if there is the requested property value, false otherwise.

      • getInt

        public int getInt(java.lang.String name)
        Get integer representation of the property value associated with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - name of the property value
        Returns:
        integer value for the property. If there's no such property, 0 is returned (FIXME:)

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String name)
        Get String representation of the property value assiciated with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - name of the property value
        Returns:
        String value for the property.

      • loadConfiguration

        public static TorpedoProperties loadConfiguration()
        Load configuration in torpedo.properties file and convert it into TorpedoProperties object and return it. As this method follows singleton pattern, it returns the same TorpedoProperties object always.
        Returns:
        TorpedoProperties object
